name: Crypto Market Data APIs
title: Crypto Market Data APIs

api_list.name: Get Specific Rate
api_list.description: Get exchange rates between pair of requested assets pointing at a specific or current time.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://crypto-market-data-apis.p.rapidapi.com/exchange-rates/btc/usd"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "crypto-market-data-apis.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Historical Data
api_list.description: Get history transactions from specific symbol, returned in time ascending order. If no start & end time is defined when calling the endpoint, your data results will be provided 24 hours back, by default.
api_list.code:
import requests

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "crypto-market-data-apis.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Bitcoin Testnet Transaction Index by Block Hash Endpoint
api_list.description: The Transaction Index by Block Endpoint returns detailed information about a list of transactions. The endpoint is useable both with block height and block hash. index and limit query parameters might also be used, as their default values are, as follows: 0, 1. Therefore, if none is specified the returned object will be the first transaction (the coinbase transaction) included in the block.

api_list.name: Ethereum Mainnet Transactions Fee Endpoint
api_list.description: Transactions Fee Endpoint gives information about the gas price for the successfull transactions included in the last 1500 blocks. min shows the lowest gas price, max is the highest and average - the average gas price. recommended is the gas price that we consider as the one that corresponds to a cheap and fast execution. However, it is only a suggestion and should be used at users' sole discretion. All gas prices are in Gwei.
